business.headline: Gold price today: Check price of 24 carat gold in metro cities?The increase comes as the global gold market reacts to a weaker US dollar and rising geopolitical tensions, particularly between Russia and Ukraine.
Bitcoin hits record high, breaches $94,000 markBitcoin rallied to a fresh all-time high of $94,000, driven by the debut of the first Bitcoin ETF options.

NTPC Green Energy IPO GMP dips: Is it worth subscribing? 3 risks to considerNTPC Green Energy IPO: The price band has been set between Rs 102 and Rs 108 per share, with a minimum application size of 138 shares, amounting to Rs 14,904 for retail investors.
Goldman's bullish call: Why gold is set to outshine by 2025Goldman Sachs analysts are bullish on the prices and have set a target of $3,000 per ounce for gold by December 2025.

Is the stock market closed today for Maharashtra elections? Share Market Closed Today, NSE, BSE Holiday: The most recent holiday was on November 15 for Guru Nanak Jayanti. The next holiday is scheduled for December 25, Christmas Day.

NTPC Green Energy IPO Day 1: Check latest subscription, GMPThe initial public offering (IPO) of NTPC Green Energy Limited opened for bidding on Tuesday looking to raise Rs 10,000 crore through a fresh issue entirely of 92.59 crore shares.

Explained: 3 reasons why Sensex, Nifty failed to sustain relief rallyThe benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty, surged over 1% in early trade, with the Sensex climbing more than 1,000 points intraday. However, by the end of the session, most of these gains were erased.

RBI warns public about deepfake videos of top officials giving financial adviceIn a press release, the central bank clarified that these videos are fake and warned people not to engage with or believe in them.
Sensex and Nifty bounce back but bears still hold control; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 239.37 points to close at 77,578.38, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 64.70 points to end at 23,518.50.
Can cryptocurrency be the next gold? With strong support and remarkable returns, Bitcoin is now increasingly seen as a potential alternative to gold, despite its volatility and regulatory challenges.

Sensex, Nifty rebound: Will the relief rally on D-Street continue or fizzle out?Stock market today: While the market did show some signs of recovery today, the sharp decline in the final hours has left retail investors in an uncertain situation.

Sensex surges 1,000 points. All you need to know in 5 pointsThe rally saw the market capitalisation of all listed companies on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) jump by Rs 6.06 lakh crore to Rs 435.14 lakh crore.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: 3 reasons why you should subscribeNTPC Green Energy IPO: The subscription for NTPC Green Energy IPO will close on November 22, 2024 and the price band is set between Rs 102 and Rs 108 per share.

Honasa Consumer share price tumbles over 30% in two trading sessions. What next?Honasa Consumer share price: The sharp sell-off was triggered by a disappointing set of September quarter results and concerns over the company's near-term growth outlook.

Explained: Why Suzlon Energy share price hit 5% upper circuit today Suzlon Energy share price: The jump in its share price came after brokerage Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock to 'Overweight' from 'Equal-weight.'

Is it a good time to buy gold? 3 things you should knowGold Price: On the MCX, gold futures maturing on December 5, 2024, were priced at Rs 75,450 per 10 grams, reflecting an increase of Rs 403 or 0.54%. The previous close was Rs 75,047.
IRFC, RVNL, IRCTC, IRCON: Why these railway stocks are gaining todayRailway stocks saw sharp gains during the session, led by IRFC, which rose over 5%.

Zinka Logistics IPO allotment: How to check status, latest GMP and other detailsZinka Logistics IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or through the registrar, KFin Technologies.

Nirmala Sitharaman calls for 'affordable' interest rates after Piyush GoyalThe Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has kept key interest rates unchanged since February 2023, citing persistent inflation pressures.

Sensex surges 1,000 points, snaps 7-session losing streak. Is the worst over?Sensex today: At 11:36 am, the Sensex was up 1044.89 points at 78,383.90, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 304.50 points to 23,758.30.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Ensure fair bypolls: Election Commission to UP officials amid voters' identity rowThe Election Commission has also ordered the suspension of police officials who violated guidelines to check the identity cards of voters who came to cast their ballots for the Meerapur Assembly seat in Uttar Pradesh.

As Maharashtra votes, 7 big factors that could swing the election decisively2024 Maharashtra Assembly Election: Maharashtra is a big state and the Assembly election issues are diverse. As Maharashtra votes today, here's a look at seven big factors, from OBC consolidation, Maratha votes to BJP-Congress direct fights, that could swing the poll decisively.

US embassy in Kyiv closes due to air threat amid Russia-Ukraine escalationRussia Ukraine War: In a statement, the US embassy announced a temporary closure. US citizens in Ukraine were also advised to prepare for potential air raid alerts and take necessary precautions.

Journalist killed in BMW hit-and-run, body thrown 100 metres on impactBMW Hit and Run: A Telugu channel video journalist in Chennai was killed when he was hit by a speeding luxury car on an elevated highway. Such was the impact that he was thrown 100 m away from the accident spot.
Do you like your chai piping hot? Cancer caution aheadExperts suggest that while tea or coffee themselves may not directly contribute to cancer, their temperature can play a significant role.

Body of UP Dalit girl found in sack, family claims she was killed for backing BJPKarhal Dalit Woman Murder: The family of the woman claimed that she was raped before being killed. They also alleged political motives behind the crime in Karhal, which went to polls on Wednesday.

AR Rahman uses hashtag on divorce post. Internet is puzzledAR Rahman and his wife Saira Banu announced their separation on November 19. However, the Internet was puzzled to see the composer use a bizarre hashtag on a sensitive post as this.

I know you, you are very famous: Indonesian President praises JaishankarThe External Affairs Minister received warm compliments from Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto as he and PM Narendra Modi arrived for a bilateral meeting on the sidelines of the G20 Summit.

Elon Musk launched a banana to space on Starship: Here's whyThis lighthearted approach not only generated public interest but also showcased the company's ability to blend serious aerospace engineering with pop culture references.

Maharashtra, Jharkhand vote in NDA vs INDIA battle Live UpdatesIn Maharashtra, a total of 4,136 candidates are contesting across 288 constituencies. While in Jharkhand, more than 500 candidates, including Chief Minister Hemant Soren and his wife Kalpana Soren, are contesting in 38 of the total 81 Assembly seats.

Will US ever get a woman President? Only if she is Republican, says Bill ClintonIn the CBS News interview, Bill Clinton also expressed hope for a woman to occupy the Oval Office, saying, "I still think we'll have a female president pretty soon."

After AR Rahman, his bassist Mohini Dey announces separation from husbandMohini Dey Divorce News: Bassist Mohini Dey, renowned for her work with AR Rahman, has announced her separation from husband Mark Hartsuch.

Is Biden trying to do a Capitol Hill on Trump with World War 3US President Joe Biden has allowed Ukraine the use of American missiles to hit deep inside Russia. Putin had warned against crossing this red line. As the Ukraine-Russia war escalates and people fear World War 3, many are asking if this was Biden's attempt at a 2021-Capitol-Hill-like situation against President-elect Donald Trump.

Who is Linda McMahon, WWE co-founder named by Trump as Education Secretary?Linda McMahon headed the Small Business Administration in Donald Trump's first administration and was a major donor and early supporter of the US President-elect when he first ran for the White House almost 10 years ago.

Bengaluru professor shocked by Class 10 AI exam paper: Code simple chatbot for 4 marksA Bengaluru-based assistant professor from the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) was shocked to see a Class 10 question paper that had asked students to code a simple chatbot for four marks.

Not my voice, fake messages: Supriya Sule denies 'crypto funds for polls' chargeSupriya Sule on 'Bitcoin Scam' Allegations: The NCP (SP) leader dismissed the allegations a day after BJP's Sudhanshu Trivedi played audio clips at a presser, accusing Supriya Sule and Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole of indulging in illegal bitcoin transactions to change the results of the Assembly polls.

Italian village offers $1 homes to Americans looking to relocate after Trump winOllolai, a small, picturesque village in Italy is making headlines with an unusual pitch to Americans seeking an escape after Donald Trump's re-election: homes for as little as one euro ($1.06).

What 'Adani' twist in the Sharad-Ajit Pawar tale impliesWas Ajit Pawar's claim a masterstroke against his uncle or a self-goal that indicates the potential involvement of powerful corporates in political upheavals in Maharashtra?

Kangana Ranaut praises Aryan Khan for choosing direction over actingKangana Ranaut praised Aryan Khan's choice to direct instead of acting. Shah Rukh Khan and Karan Johar also celebrated his debut as a director for an upcoming Netflix series, tentatively titled, Stardom.

Dhoni once touted Bumrah as a potential captain: Matthew Hayden AUS vs IND: Responding to a query from IndiaToday.in during a virtual media interaction, former Australian batter Matthew Hayden heaped praise on Jasprit Bumrah before the Perth Test and said that MS Dhoni once identified his skills as a potential captain.

Messi to play in India? Kerala Sports Minister hopeful of hosting ArgentinaKerala Sports Minister V. Abdurahiman revealed that the Argentina football team, including legendary player Lionel Messi, will visit Kerala next year (2025) for an international match.

Elon Musk roasts Jaguar over new logo. See British carmaker's response   Jaguar New Logo: Jaguar shared their rebrand video with the caption, "Copy nothing," showcasing a 30-second advert that focuses on vibrant visuals rather than vehicles.

Delhi government orders 50% of its employees to work from home amid pollutionDelhi AQI: As Delhi continues to grapple with the worsening air pollution crisis, the AAP government has decided to implement work from home in government offices.

Biden front and centre as world leaders retake G20 family photoG20 Summit in Brazil: After missing the G20 family shot on Monday, US President Joe Biden was given a spot near the middle of the front row of the assembled world leaders as they retook the photo.

Diljit Dosanjh's new show in Mumbai: Check date, how to book tickets and moreDiljit Dosanjh announced the details of his new Mumbai show on Wednesday. He is currently touring India as part of his ongoing Dil-Luminati India tour.

Ram Charan, Janhvi Kapoor to begin shooting for RC 16 in MysoreActor Ram Charan, fresh off the excitement surrounding Game Changer, is gearing up for his next big project with Janhvi Kapoor. Tentatively titled RC 16, the film is being directed by Buchi Babu Sana.

Shah Rukh Khan on his parents' death: Will meet them again for sureShah Rukh Khan shared how losing his parents early motivated him to work hard. Shah Rukh's father died when he was just a teenager, and his mother died a decade later when he was only 24.

Pics, video: Mammootty, Mohanlal film with Mahesh Narayanan begins in Sri LankaMalayalam director Mahesh Narayanan's film starring Mammootty and Mohanlal began shooting on November 19, 2024. The big-budget film started its first schedule in Colombo, Sri Lanka.

sports.headline: Akash Deep is potential replacement for Mohammad Shami: Matthew HaydenMatthew Hayden said that Akash Deep could be the potential replacement for Mohammad Shami in the first 2 Tests at Perth and Adelaide vs Australia. Shami was not included in India's 18-member jumbo squad for the Border Gavaskar Trophy series.

Australia vs India: Can weakened India breach Perth fortress?The Border-Gavaskar Trophy is almost here! Aren't you excited? India have been sensational in their last two tours of Australia. However, with a team in transition that has a few injury and availability concerns, it seems that India are on the back foot early in the series.

Call on Shubman Gill will be taken on morning of Perth Test: Morne MorkelBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Shubman Gill is racing against time to be fit for the Test series opener in Perth. Gill fractured his thumb last week after getting hit during a simulation exercise at the iconic WACA in Perth.

Kohli will be key to India's chances of completing a hat-trick of series win in Australia.

Gambhir will be looking to use his ever-constant approach of remaining defiant and undeterred to make a statement during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and shut down his critics.

Watch Sachin Tendulkar votes in Mumbai along with wife Anjali, daughter SaraMaharashtra Elections: Batting great Sachin Tendulkar voted early in Mumbai on Wednesday and urged fellow citizens to exercise their democratic duty. Tendulkar posed along with his wife and daughter from the polling station.

Brazil draw 1-1 vs Uruguay, Argentina beat Peru to close in on World Cup spotFIFA World Cup South American qualifiers: Brazil shared points with Uruguay after a 1-1 draw, while Argentina secured a narrow 1-0 win over Peru. The results leave Argentina close to World Cup qualification, with Brazil under pressure to secure their spot.

The tournament is set to kick off on November 23, a day before the IPL 2024 mega auction takes place in Jeddah.

Rafael Nadal retires: 'Good person from a small village' bids goodbye to tennisRafael Nadal Retirement: Rafael Nadal's glorious career ended on a bittersweet note as Spain lost their quarter-finals to the Netherlands in Mallaga on Tuesday. Nadal lost the last match of his professional career, but only after showcasing glimpses of his famous fighting spirit.

KL Rahul isn't setting the stage on fire as an opener: Sanjay Manjrekar Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar is against the idea of opening with KL Rahul in the first Test against Australia in Perth on November 22.

Valiant Rafael Nadal goes down fighting in 'farewell' clashDavis Cup Finals: Rafael Nadal fought out of his skins, but lost to Botic van de Zandschulp in the singles match of the Spain vs Netherlands quarterfinals on Tuesday in Malaga. The Dutchman took an hour and 52 minutes to beat the Spanish legend.

SL vs NZ: Sri Lanka take series 2-0 after third ODI gets called off due to rainSri Lanka completed a 2-0 series win over New Zealand in the three-match ODI series after the third ODI was called off due to incessant rain in Pallekele.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
